name: Antipasto
author: Karen
summary: This recipe makes a huge amount. I can it and give it away as Christmas gifts. We usually make this as a group project to cut down on prep time and cost. The ingredient amounts may be altered proportionally as needed.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon pickling spice, wrapped in cheesecloth
1 ½ (5 ounce) cans tuna, drained and flaked
directions: In a large bowl with enough lightly salted water to cover, place the cauliflower, pearl onions, red bell peppers, green bell peppers, celery and cucumbers
In a small bowl with enough lightly salted water to cover, place the carrots
In a large saucepan, place the vegetable oil, vinegar, tomato paste and pickling spice
Bring the mixture to a boil
Drain and rinse the carrots, and place them in the mixture
Drain and rinse the vegetables in the cauliflower mixture
Cook 10 minutes, or until the cauliflower is tender but crisp
Stir black olives, green olives, mushrooms and tuna into the mixture
While still hot, transfer to sterile containers and refrigerate
